divs: sighting detailssitting with friends outside of a home in the south hills in missoula, mt at about 2140 hours on 05\04\08, i noticed a bright amber\golden colored light on the western horizon rising above the mountain. the size of the lights from our vantage point seemed to be about the size of penny (if held at arms length). we knew for certain that they were much bigger than that if we had been up close. i told my husband to look (he was sitting next to me) and he said it looked like a plane reflecting the sunset. this seemed completely logical to us at the moment. not more than 3 or 4 minutes later, i saw another light - followed by 3 more. all of them were slowly rising from beyond the mountain in the west in succession. i "freaked out," jumped up and called for my friends who i was with to get out in the open and see this. we all gathered in the street (there were 7 of us) and watched them slowly rise to just about a quarter of the way to the middle point of the night sky (right above) - they stayed in the western sky. they floated up very slowly (as if one took the place of the other). one appeared to move slightly southward, one stayed in place for about 30 seconds and the others just kept moving eastward (closer to the center of the sky (straight above). each slowly faded away (one after another) and were gone. a neighbor of mine took photos of the event - which turned out. she contacted the local news - but they did not respond. another witness even called 911 shortly after the event to see if anyone had reported it - they had not. all of us have been asking people we know if they saw the lights and apparently nobody else was outside at the time. since they were moving so slow and were so big and faded out, our theory of light reflecting off planes was easily dismissed. we were told about the arizona light incident and felt that they could have similar to it. at this point, we are still unsure as to what it was and apparently were the only people we know that saw it. would love to find other folks who may have witnessed the event.
